transcript.text: My name is Catherine.
I'm 58 years old.
I live in Haute-Vienne,
in the Limoges region.
I have three children.
Actually, I had three children.
The oldest, Marion, was murdered in June 2018
by an Algerian illegal
whom she had met at work.
She kindly took him in.
He had come to France to get the citizenship
and enter into a marriage.
She refused.
He killed her by stabbing her 11 times,
and he buried her in the garden.
The name of this Algerian illegal
is Djillali Bellabes.
He's been arrested four times.
Released four times.
If Mr. Zemmour had been part of the government,
I don't think it could have happened.

I think he would have been expelled
 the first time he was arrested.
I'm putting all my hopes on his candidacy.
It's now or never. I believe in him.
I've believed in him since his Villepinte rally.
I know he's the one.
There must be no more "Marion".
There must be no more grieving families.
Our lives changed dramatically on June 7, 2018.
The lives of my grandchildren,
who will never have a mom again,
changed dramatically, too.
Vote for Éric Zemmour.
Believe in him, I'm begging you.
He's the only one who can find a solution

to illegal immigration,
 which is eating away at us.
